---

## GAD-7 vs ESPAD

GAD-7 vs ESPAD In the world of social sciences and psychology, the need to compare and harmonise varying questionnaires is a crucial but often time-consuming task. Imagine the challenge of comparing the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) with the European School Survey Project on Alcohol and Drugs - Tobacco (ESPAD). While the GAD-7 is a measurement tool for assessing generalised anxiety symptoms, ESPAD focuses on the habits and effects of smoking. Given the stark differences between them, how can we objectively put the GAD-7 vs ESPAD in a meaningful and cost-effective way? Enter Harmony, a software tool developed with the precise goal of addressing this unique challenge. Harmony applies natural language processing and generative AI models to correlate attributes in different questionnaires in a bid to simplify harmonisation. Whether it's GAD-7 vs ESPAD or any other comparative study, Harmony delivers a percentage match between different items, based on its state-of-the-art language model. The tools provided by Harmony make for a more objective, efficient and practically feasible approach with comparisons GAD-7 vs ESPAD becoming quick and consistent. Harmony's easy-to-use interface allows the selection of instruments from its database or lets you upload your own in PDF format. The software tool does not stop at comparing English questionnaires alone but extends its services to multiple languages. This means it's even possible to do a GAD-7 vs ESPAD comparison in several languages, paving the way for more comprehensive, global studies. With Harmony at the helm, expect the GAD-7 vs ESPAD and similar comparative studies to become less daunting and more streamlined.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
